marketNews.title: CPO Price Reaches RM4.500, Highest in 5 Months
marketNews.content: CPO prices for the November 2025 contract strengthened +0.2% from Friday (15/8) closing to the level of 4,520 Malaysian Ringgit per ton as of Tuesday (19/8), marking a +6.4% MTD increase and the highest level in the last 5 months. This increase was mainly driven by: 1) increased demand from India and China; and 2) tightening supply from Indonesia.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway: Biofuel Funding Sufficiency Scrutiny
marketNews.content: The sufficiency of palm oil funds to finance (subsidize) the biodiesel program is something investors need to observe, in our opinion. The Director General at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Eniya Listiani Dewi, stated that they are requesting additional fund allocation approval from the Palm Oil Plantation Fund Management Agency, citing the widening price disparity between CPO products and fuel oil or diesel used as the raw material for biodiesel.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need to Know...
marketNews.content: 1. Economists consensus surveyed by Reuters estimates that Bank Indonesia will maintain the BI Rate at 5.25% in the Board of Governors Meeting tomorrow, Wednesday (20/8). 2. The Director General at the Ministry of Finance, Febrio Nathan Kacaribu, stated on Friday (15/8) that there will be no change in the Value Added Tax (PPN) tariff policy in 2026. The Ministry of Finance confirmed that the 12% VAT rate will remain applicable to luxury goods, while the rate for general goods or non-luxury goods remains 11%. In the 2026 State Budget Draft itself, the government targets tax revenue to grow +13% YoY compared to the 2025 State Budget outlook. This target is based on the implementation of tax reform and the projection of solid domestic consumption levels. 3. Bloomberg reported that a number of analysts assessed that Indonesia risks exceeding the 2026 State Budget Draft deficit target of 2.48% of GDP due to the absence of plans for new taxation measures amid President Prabowo Subianto's populist programs. The government targeted state revenue of 3,148 trillion rupiah in the 2026 State Budget Draft, jumping +10% YoY from the 2025 State Budget outlook, supported by a +13% YoY increase in tax revenue targets. According to Fitch Solutions' research unit, BMI, this state revenue target appears too optimistic, considering the lack of new taxation measures, which will likely result in the government exceeding the fiscal deficit target in 2026. Meanwhile, Maybank maintained its projection for Indonesia's fiscal deficit in 2026 at 2.9% of GDP, based on a more moderate projection for state revenue growth of +7% YoY, approaching nominal GDP growth. 4. The General Chairman of the Indonesian Ceramics Association, Edy Suyanto, stated that the ceramics industry in West Java experienced a reduction in the allocation of Specific Natural Gas Price (HGBT) from 60% to 48% following restrictions imposed by Perusahaan Gas Negara ($PGAS). Edy mentioned that these restrictions will apply from August 13-31, 2025, with usage above the quota being subject to a surcharge of 14.8 US Dollars per MMBtu.

marketNews.title: Pullback vs Breakout: Entry Strategy Determining Trading Results
marketNews.content: "Wait for confirmation, for example, candle close above/below an important level, or supportive volume." - JhonWong

tickerNews.title: BBCA 7M25: Bank Only Net Profit +11% YoY
tickerNews.content: $BBCA: Bank Central Asia recorded bank only net profit of 4.8 trillion rupiah in July 2025 (-2% YoY, +2% MoM). This result brought bank only net profit for 7M25 to 34.7 trillion rupiah (+11% YoY), equivalent to 60% of the consensus 2025F consolidated net profit estimate (vs. 7M24: 57% realization of 2024 consolidated net profit). In July 2025, the decline in net profit was caused by an increase in tax expense (+24% YoY, +20% MoM) and provision expense (+233% YoY, +84% MoM), amid Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) growth of +7% YoY and +8% MoM. During 7M25, net profit growth was driven by solid PPOP growth of +12% YoY, although provision expense rose +65% YoY. Solid PPOP during 7M25 was supported by Non-Interest Income (Non-II) growing +18% YoY, while Net Interest Income (NII) grew only +6% YoY amid credit growth of +11% YoY.

tickerNews.title: PANI 1H25 Net Profit Flat, Driven by Strong 2Q25 Results
tickerNews.content: $PANI: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua recorded net profit of 236 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (+45% YoY, +377% QoQ), resulting in 1H25 net profit being flat at 286 billion rupiah (+0.3% YoY). The net profit growth in 2Q25 was supported by revenue growth (+46% YoY, +69% QoQ) and a gross profit margin increasing to 60.1% (vs. 2Q24: 53.9%, 1Q25: 56.2%). Meanwhile, PANI's subsidiary, Bangun Kosambi Sukses ($CBDK), recorded net profit of 387 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (+100% YoY, +198% QoQ), resulting in 1H25 net profit growing to 517 billion rupiah (+26% YoY). Net profit growth in 2Q25 was supported by revenue growth (+66% YoY, +80% QoQ) and gross profit margin expansion to 63.4% (vs. 2Q24: 57.0%, 1Q25: 55.9%).

tickerNews.title: PGEO and PLN Indonesia Power to Form Consortium for Geothermal Projects
tickerNews.content: $PGEO: Kontan reported that PT PLN Indonesia Power and Pertamina Geothermal Energy will form a consortium to work on geothermal power plants (PLTP). This cooperation is a follow-up step after both parties signed a head of agreement to work on the 30 MW Ulubelu Binary Unit PLTP project in Lampung and the 15 MW Lahendong Binary Unit PLTP project in North Sulawesi. Besides these two PLTP projects, the head of agreement also contains an agreement between the two parties to explore the development of geothermal energy in various work areas, with an indicative total capacity reaching 530 MW.

tickerNews.title: PGAS Gas Pressure Stabilizes Following Additional Supply Confirmation
tickerNews.content: $PGAS: Perusahaan Gas Negara stated that the gas pressure in the pipeline network is starting to stabilize following additional gas supply to fill the gas stock in the pipeline network. PGAS also mentioned that the certainty of additional gas supplies has also been confirmed and will be utilized to enhance operational reliability. Previously, PGAS reported a decrease in gas distribution to several customers in the West Java and parts of Sumatra regions due to an unplanned shutdown from existing gas suppliers.

tickerNews.title: AMMN Director Sells 40 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: $AMMN: Amman Mineral Internasional Director, Irwin Ka Pui Wan, sold 40 million AMMN shares at an average price of 8,595 rupiah per share on August 15, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 343.8 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership portion of Irwin Ka Pui Wan in AMMN decreased from 0.109% to 0.054%.

tickerNews.title: Palm Oil Company Stocks Rally MTD Driven by CPO Price Strength
tickerNews.content: The strengthening of CPO prices has driven a rally in the stock prices of palm oil issuers MTD, such as DSNG (+15.6%), TAPG (+5.9%), AALI (+8.8%), SGRO (+33.3%), and BWPT (+14%).

tickerNews.title: Ceramic Industry Utility in West Java Threatened by Restricted Gas Quota from PGAS
tickerNews.content: The General Chairman of the Indonesian Ceramics Association, Edy Suyanto, stated that the ceramic industry in West Java experienced a reduction in the allocation of Specific Natural Gas Price (HGBT) from 60% to 48% following restrictions imposed by Perusahaan Gas Negara ($PGAS). Edy mentioned that these restrictions will apply from August 13-31, 2025, with usage above the quota being subject to a surcharge of 14.8 US Dollars per MMBtu.

tickerNews.title: KABELINDO MURNI Major Shareholder Increases Stake
tickerNews.content: The Controller of Kabelindo Murni ($KBLM), PT Sibalec, purchased approximately 69.9 million KBLM shares at an average price of 386.36 rupiah per share on August 14, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 27 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership portion of PT Sibalec in KBLM increased from 34.03% to 40.27%.
